description: Two-character postal abbreviation for the jurisdiction (U.S. state or D.C.) used in addresses, registrations, and regulatory reporting.
Official long name of the jurisdiction corresponding to the abbreviation; used for display, reporting, and master data lookups.
Flag indicating the organizationâ€™s default operating/registration jurisdiction for new records (e.g., vehicles, drivers, locations); likely Yes/No. Meaning may vary by tenant; confirm with SME.
User ID or system service that created the record for audit trail and data lineage.
Timestamp when the record was created in the application, used for auditing and change history.
User ID or system service that last modified the record for audit and traceability.
Timestamp of the most recent update to the record, supporting audit trails and data synchronization.
